bugs.title: CVE-2012-5657 php-ZendFramework: information disclosure flaw due to error when processing XML data

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2012-5657 php-ZendFramework: information disclosure flaw due to error when processing XML data

long_desc.thetext:
A vulnerability was reported in Zend Framework versions prior to 1.11.15 and 1.12.1, which can be exploited to disclose certain sensitive information.  This flaw is caused due to an error in the "Zend_Feed_Rss" and "Zend_Feed_Atom" classes of the "Zend_Feed" component, when processing XML data.  It can be used to disclose the contents of certain local files by sending specially crafted XML data including external entity references.


External References:

http://framework.zend.com/security/advisory/ZF2012-05

Created php-ZendFramework tracking bugs for this issue

Affects: fedora-all [bug 889038]
Affects: epel-6 [bug 889039]

The CVE identifier of CVE-2012-5657 has been assigned to this issue:
http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2012/12/20/4
php-ZendFramework-1.12.1-1.fc18 has been pushed to the Fedora 18 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
php-ZendFramework-1.12.1-1.fc16 has been pushed to the Fedora 16 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
php-ZendFramework-1.12.1-1.fc17 has been pushed to the Fedora 17 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
